author: craigmcc
msg: Fix the behavior of the new PropertyMessageResources implementation when
the default Locale of the JVM is set to something different than the US
standard (such as nl_NL).
NOTE 1:  I applied only the first two patches that Johan supplied.  In my
opinion, trading off space for time (by having multiple keys per message)
is a good deal for most Struts-based applications.  The number of message
strings in most apps is relatively small, and I want the dominant use case
(accessing the same message repeatedly as the application runs) to be as
fast when using a Locale of "nl" as when using a locale of "nl_NL"
(assuming you've selected one language or the other as the default :-).
NOTE 2:  Using the new architecture for message resources, you can now
create your own MessageResources implementation (that reads from a
ResourceBundle, for example, as Johan's third patch did) without having
to patch the existing implementation.  Simply subclass the
MessageResources and MessageResourcesFactory classes as appropriate.
Submitted by: Johan Compagner <jcompagner@j-com.nl>

author: mschachter
msg: - fixed attribute case for html events on form:image tag
Submitted By: Michael Westbay

author: mschachter
msg: - created a bare-bones demonstration of how to utilize file uploading in
struts
- the file will be build in the binary distribution as
/webapps/struts-upload.war

author: mschachter
msg: - Removed debugging statement

author: mschachter
msg: - changed "user-agent" header name to "User-Agent".  This change should
have no effect on servlet spec compliant containers, but it's defined as
"User-Agent" in the HTTP 1.0/1.1 spec
